definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Four new crematory are commissioned at the fu shan crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 富山火葬场四个新火化炉投入服务。

sentences.english: New cremators commissioned at the Fu Shan Crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 富山火葬场新火化炉投入服务。

sentences.english: Decommission the existing crematorium after the satisfactory commissioning of the new one.
sentences.chinese: 在新火化炉顺利运作后，拆卸现有的火葬场。

sentences.english: The office is in behind of crematory( Sifang Dashan).
sentences.chinese: 活动办公室在火葬场后面。

sentences.english: The access road adjacent to the diamond hill funeral parlour leading to sze chen hall of diamond hill crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 毗连钻石山殡仪馆，通往钻石山火葬场思亲堂的通路。

sentences.english: Improved crematoria with ventilation systems and smokestacks took shape.
sentences.chinese: 改进对通风系统和烟囱形成了火葬场。

sentences.english: She is surrounded by jackals and other unholy creatures, the denizens of the cremation ground.
sentences.chinese: 她被豺狼和其他不神圣的人围绕着，那是火葬场的人。

sentences.english: After cremation, water is used to cool gases in the crematorium chimney.
sentences.chinese: 火化之后要用水来冷却火葬场烟囱中的气体。

sentences.english: She clutched her fist tightly and searched for the figure of Otsu beside the funeral pyres.
sentences.chinese: 她握紧五根手指，往火葬场方向寻找大津的影子。

sentences.english: Our family reached the crematorium to condole on him.
sentences.chinese: 我们全家去火葬场吊唁他的去世。

sentences.english: Looking back, I caught sight of a lonely crematorium looming⑤ out of a pine wood.
sentences.chinese: 回头望见松原里的一座孤寂的火葬场。

sentences.english: Our family reached the crematorium to condole on him.
sentences.chinese: 我们全家去火葬场吊唁时。

sentences.english: You know my friend Chris who owns the crematorium ?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我那个开火葬场的朋友克里斯吧？

sentences.english: The access road adjacent to the diamond hill funeral parlour leading to sze chen hall of diamond hill crematorium .
sentences.chinese: 毗连钻石山殡仪馆，通往钻石山火葬场思亲堂的通路。

sentences.english: City Crematorium flowers honor the district, only two graves in the area.
sentences.chinese: 市火葬场鲜花拜祭区，只有两人在该区拜祭。

sentences.english: Lao Li's been working as a funeral furnisher for more than 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 老李已经在火葬场工作了二十多年了。

definition: to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
to keep the body of the deceased (until burial or cremation)
